metadata.title: CVE-2024-32459 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
FreeRDP is a free implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol. FreeRDPbased clients and servers that use a version of FreeRDP prior to 3.5.0 or2.11.6 are vulnerable to out-of-bounds read. Versions 3.5.0 and 2.11.6patch the issue. No known workarounds are available.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-32459` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freerdp2-shadow-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
freerdp2-wayland - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
freerdp2-x11 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp-client2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp-server2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp-shadow-subsystem2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp-shadow2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libfreerdp2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libuwac0-0 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libwinpr-tools2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
libwinpr2-2 - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
winpr-utils - 2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freerdp2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.1+dfsg1-3ubuntu2.6').
